metadata.synopsis: Speak with Dead dialogue for Naaber. Unlike most characters, he will talk to his killer and ignore the "power of the spell waning" limit.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Go to Carmen's cosmetics shop ( S_WYR_FigaroSister_DEBUG_Point_5d7b1276-f516-49f2-b3ea-3564b25cd35c ) and enter to make Naaber follow you.- Lead him outside, somewhere unseen, and Ctrl+Shift+K kill him.- "addDebugSpell Target_SpeakWithDead_Test"- Cast the SwD spell on him.

72.speaker: Naaber
72.text: Son of... Niiber... son of... Nuuber...

45.speaker: Naaber
45.text: Sorry not... to have... met you... properly... when I... was... still alive...

10.speaker: Naaber
10.text: Oh the... conversations... we could... have had...

11.speaker: Player
11.text: What were you doing before you died?

88.speaker: Naaber
88.text: An adventurer... but I... couldn't... figure out... what... kind...

49.speaker: Naaber
49.text: Always... fancied myself... a bit of... a bard...

18.speaker: Naaber
18.text: But I... don't know... how to... play... an instrument...

12.speaker: Naaber
12.text: I guess... we'll never... find out... now...

33.speaker: Naaber
33.text: Shame... the stories... I could... have told...

14.speaker: Naaber
14.text: Alive... But now... that I'm... dead...

29.speaker: Naaber
29.text: I will... have... to... try... even... harder... to be... heard...

32.speaker: Player
32.text: What was your profession before you tried to be an adventurer?

39.speaker: Naaber
39.text: Once... I tried... to be... a shopkeeper...

83.speaker: Naaber
83.text: But... I never... made... enough... sales...

4.speaker: Naaber
4.text: I... had... so many... nice... conversations... with... the customers...

38.speaker: Naaber
38.text: I... told... them... everything... there was... to know... about... the... produce...

17.speaker: Naaber
17.text: And that's... how I realised... I wasn't... supposed... to be... a shopkeeper...

6.speaker: Naaber
6.text: *The spell's power wanes - but the spirit refuses to be silent.*

82.speaker: Narrator
82.text: *The spell's power wanes - but the spirit refuses to be silent.*

89.speaker: Naaber
89.text: I... regret... not... being... your... friend...

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Have you always been so talkative?

70.speaker: Naaber
70.text: My... father... learned... from his father... who learned... from his father...

8.speaker: Naaber
8.text: That... we... have... to be... persistent...

71.speaker: Naaber
71.text: He always... said... if at first... people don't... listen...

87.speaker: Naaber
87.text: Ha... ha... us... Noobers... sure do... like... to talk...

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Has anyone ever told you you're really annoying?

50.speaker: Naaber
50.text: But... I... try not... to... let it... get... to me...

65.speaker: Naaber
65.text: I... don't... understand... why... everyone... else... isn't... the same... way...

63.speaker: Naaber
63.text: Isn't it... lovely... to talk... to someone...?

58.speaker: Naaber
58.text: Did... I... ever... tell... you... about... that... time... I tried... to be... a chef?

44.speaker: Naaber
44.text: It... was... three... years... ago... but... I... remember it... like... yesterday...

90.speaker: Naaber
90.text: First... I tried... to be... a... pastry... chef...

24.speaker: Naaber
24.text: Then... I... tried... to... specialise... in... fish...

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *Time passes. You can practically feel your hairs growing, and your eyes watering from trying to stay awake.*

7.speaker: Naaber
7.text: And... that's... how... I... realised... that... being a... chef... wasn't... for me...

22.speaker: Player
22.text: How do I make this stop?

16.speaker: Narrator
16.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

37.speaker: Naaber
37.text: Don't... you... want... to... know... more...

34.speaker: Naaber
34.text: I have... so much... more... to tell... you...

77.speaker: Narrator
77.text: *His body longs to rest, but his spirit doesn't stop talking, even as he returns to what one can only hope are the deepest depths of the Hells.*

74.speaker: Naaber
74.text: Wait... we... have... only... just... started... talking...
